briefdescription.para: Callback for when a path is completed.

detaileddescription.para: Movement scripts should register to this delegate. A temporary callback can also be set when calling StartPath, but that delegate will only be called for that path

briefdescription.para: For anything which requires the original nodes (Node[]) (before modifiers) to work.
Anything which only modifies the positions (Vector3[])
Called before pathfinding is started.
Saves nearest nodes for previous path to enable faster Get Nearest Node calls.

detaileddescription.para: This variable basically does not a affect anything at the moment. So it is hidden in the inspector

briefdescription.para: Penalties for each tag.

detaileddescription.para:
Tag 0 which is the default tag, will have added a penalty of tagPenalties[0]. These should only be positive values since the A* algorithm cannot handle negative penalties.
This array should always have a length of 32.
Pathfinding.Path.tagPenalties

briefdescription.para: The path ID of the last path queried.
The current path.
Temporary callback only called for the current path.

detaileddescription.para: This value is set by the StartPath functions

briefdescription.para: Returns path.
Returns a new path instance.
Is the current path done calculating.

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the current path has been returned or if the path is null.

simplesect.para: Do not confuse this with Pathfinding.Path.IsDone. They do mostly return the same value, but not always.

briefdescription.para: Called once for a MultiTargetPath.

detaileddescription.para:
Only returns the path, does not post process. A* Pro Feature:
This is an A* Pathfinding Project Pro feature only. This function/class/variable might not exist in the Free version of the A* Pathfinding Project or the functionality might be limited The Pro version can be bought here

briefdescription.para: Called for each path in a MultiTargetPath.

detaileddescription.para:
Only post processes the path, does not return it. A* Pro Feature:
This is an A* Pathfinding Project Pro feature only. This function/class/variable might not exist in the Free version of the A* Pathfinding Project or the functionality might be limited The Pro version can be bought here

briefdescription.para: Called when a path has completed.

detaileddescription.para:
This should have been implemented as optional parameter values, but that didn't seem to work very well with delegates (the values weren't the default ones)
OnPathComplete(Path,bool,bool)

briefdescription.para: Called when a path has completed.

detaileddescription.para: Will post process it and return it by calling tmpPathCallback and pathCallback

briefdescription.para: Post Processes the path.

detaileddescription.para:
This will run any modifiers attached to this GameObject on the path. This is identical to calling RunModifiers(ModifierPass.PostProcess, path)
RunModifiers
Added in 3.2

briefdescription.para: Runs modifiers on path p.
Call this function to start calculating a path.

parameterdescription.para: The start point of the path
The end point of the path

briefdescription.para: Call this function to start calculating a path.

detaileddescription.para:
start
The start point of the path
end
The end point of the path
callback
The function to call when the path has been calculated
callback will be called when the path has completed. Callback will not be called if the path is canceled (e.g when a new path is requested before the previous one has completed)

memberdef.argsstring: (Vector3 start, Vector3 end, OnPathDelegate callback, int graphMask)
memberdef.name: StartPath

briefdescription.para: Call this function to start calculating a path.

detaileddescription.para:
start
The start point of the path
end
The end point of the path
callback
The function to call when the path has been calculated
graphMask
Mask used to specify which graphs should be searched for close nodes. See Pathfinding.NNConstraint.graphMask. A* Pro Feature:
This parameter does not exist or has limited functionality in the Free version of the A* Pathfinding Project
callback will be called when the path has completed. Callback will not be called if the path is canceled (e.g when a new path is requested before the previous one has completed)

briefdescription.para: Call this function to start calculating a path.

detaileddescription.para:
p
The path to start calculating
callback
The function to call when the path has been calculated
graphMask
Mask used to specify which graphs should be searched for close nodes. See Pathfinding.NNConstraint.graphMask. A* Pro Feature:
This parameter does not exist or has limited functionality in the Free version of the A* Pathfinding Project
callback will be called when the path has completed. Callback will not be called if the path is canceled (e.g when a new path is requested before the previous one has completed)

briefdescription.para: Handles path calls for a single unit.

detaileddescription.para:
This is a component which is meant to be attached to a single unit (AI, Robot, Player, whatever) to handle it's pathfinding calls. It also handles post-processing of paths using modifiers.
Pathfinding interface
